bug.short_desc: ComboBox prevents input when list is visible

long_desc.thetext:
The qx.ui.form.ComboBox shows a very uncommon behavior when the drop-down list is open during input. When the input matches the beginning of one or more items, the input field is automatically completed with the text of first matching item. If the input characters do not match any item from the list, the input is completely discarded. When the drop-down list is not visible, arbitrary input is accepted.
To my knowledge, there are different flavors of combo boxes around. Some close the list as soon as the input field is focused, others automatically select the first matching item from the list, but none auto-completes with the first match. This behavior makes it impossible for the user to input the text of any matching item which is not the first match.
BTW, ComboBoxEx in the demo works as expected.
Moved to 0.7.4. Does not really depends on #20 or 0.8 at all.

We have to decide which behavior we want to support and how to react to key input in different situations (list open/closed).
